incidents.name: Delayed Usage Data

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved.
Some of the usage data between Nov 14, 15:12 pm – Nov 14, 19:16 pm UTC may still be delayed. However, we’re actively working on backfilling the data and expect them to be synced soon.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating delays in syncing usage report data on our dashboard.

incidents.name: Performance Degradation in the FRA1 Region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incident_updates.body: We are investigating a performance degradation in our FRA1 region.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incidents.name: Incorrect IP information in request logs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Incorrect IP information is being reported in request logs. This may impact log drains and firewall rules referencing IP addresses. We're currently investigating.

incidents.name: Performance degradation in the CPT1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: The performance degradation in CPT1 has been mitigated.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: We are investigating a performance degradation in our CPT region that began at 22:28 UTC.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incidents.name: Issue with inviting new team members and deleting accounts

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue with new team member invites and account deletions erroring out.

incidents.name: Increased Request Latency in Frankfurt, Germany (fra1)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incident_updates.body: We have identified the issue and are switching to a secondary networking stack in fra1 so that we can bring the region back into service

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to investigate this issue.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incident_updates.body: We’re currently investigating increased request latency in fra1 (Frankfurt, Germany) region. End-users near this region may be experiencing degraded performance due to the increased latency, as we’re now rerouting traffic to another closest region.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - FRA1 - Frankfurt, Germany, Europe

incidents.name: Increased Request Latency in São Paulo, Brazil (gru1)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - GRU1 - São Paulo, Brazil

incident_updates.body: We have identified the issue and are switching to a secondary networking stack in gru1 so that we can bring the region back into service

affected_components.name: Edge Network - GRU1 - São Paulo, Brazil

incident_updates.body: We’re currently investigating increased request latency in gru1 (São Paulo, Brazil) region. End-users near this region may be experiencing degraded performance due to the increased latency, as we’re now rerouting traffic to another closest region.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - GRU1 - São Paulo, Brazil

incidents.name: Increased Edge Functions and Middleware error rate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

There was an increase in errors related to Edge Functions and Middleware invocations from 20:22 to 20:30 UTC. We have rerouted traffic to a different region, which has resolved the issue. We're continuing to monitor the system.

incidents.name: Delayed log drains for traffic from all regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Log Drains results are no longer delayed, but are temporarily missing metadata (projectName)
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating reports of delayed log drains results for traffic coming from all regions. We will provide further updates when available.

incidents.name: Elevated 5xx errors in cpt1 and fra1 regions

incident_updates.body:
We investigated elevated reports of 5xx errors for Edge Middleware/Functions in the <tt>cpt1</tt> (Cape Town, South Africa) and <tt>fra1</tt> (Frankfurt, Germany) regions between <tt>Oct 17, 4:24 UTC</tt> – <tt>Oct 17, 4:28 UTC</tt>.

The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue in cle1 has been mitigated. We are continuing the fix for the iad1 region.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating elevated error rates for Edge Middleware and Edge Functions for traffic in the cle1 and iad1 region.

incidents.name: Email login into Vercel blocked

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have deployed a fix for email login and are currently monitoring recovery.
Our engineering team has identified the issue and working to restore email login capabilities.
We are currently investigating an issue blocking some users ability to login to Vercel using email.

incidents.name: Intermittent traffic blocked

incident_updates.body: We have now resolved this incident and all systems are fully operational.
We are continuing to monitor the recovery and are no longer observing firewall or checkpoint blocks.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We have now deployed a fix for this issue and are monitoring.
We are currently investigating reports of intermittent blocking actions being applied to traffic targeting Vercel's APIs

incidents.name: Degradation of requests on Edge Network LHR1 (London, UK) and CDG1 (Paris, France, Europe)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe

incident_updates.body: The issue has been mitigated on the LHR1 (London, UK) Edge Network region. Our engineers are still working to restore CDG1 (Paris, France, Europe). Further updates to come.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to investigate this issue and have identified CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe as a newly affected region.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe

incident_updates.body: We have identified an Edge Network issue impacting requests within the LHR1 - London, UK region. Our engineers are currently investigating. Further updates will be provided as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Queued builds issue

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently processing the backlog of queued builds. Further updates will be provided as this progresses.
We are currently investigating reports of queued builds which may be preventing deployments from completing for some users. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated errors logging in via SAML SSO

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

A workaround to login, in the meantime, is to navigate from within your SAML provider's app instead of the Vercel scope switcher.
We are currently investigating reports where users are not able to login to Vercel Enterprise teams via SAML SSO. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated errors creating new Postgres databases

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Our upstream provider, Neon, is investigating reports of customers not being able to create new Postgres databases. Existing Postgres databases are unaffected and working as expected.

The link to the incident via Neon: https://neonstatus.com/console/incidents/01J99D4SSGG3MAQ7JJDST7TAFN

incidents.name: Intermittent increased edge function timeouts and failures in iad1 (Washington, D.C.) and cle1 (Cleveland, OH) regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CLE1 - Cleveland, East US
Edge Network - IAD1 - Washington DC, USA

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CLE1 - Cleveland, East US
Edge Network - IAD1 - Washington DC, USA

incident_updates.body: We have identified the issue and are rerouting edge function traffic to a separate region to mitigate the impact.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CLE1 - Cleveland, East US
Edge Network - IAD1 - Washington DC, USA

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating this issue.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CLE1 - Cleveland, East US
Edge Network - IAD1 - Washington DC, USA

incidents.name: Increased INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We were investigating increased INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors in the fra1 and ihr1 regions, during the following window of time: 2024-09-26 14:50-14:52 UTC.

incidents.name: Missing Build Logs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix for this issue has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating reports of Build Logs missing when viewing deployments. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Increased timeouts and 500 errors in the Dublin, Ireland region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating timeouts and 500 errors in the Dublin, Ireland region. We will provide updates once we have more information.

incidents.name: Some Hobby customers are currently experiencing delayed builds

incident_updates.body: The issue causing delays in our build queues has been successfully resolved. The fix we implemented has addressed the problem, and the delays are now gone. All build queues are operating normally again.
The engineering team has found the issue and is deploying a fix.
We are currently experiencing delays in our build processes for our Hobby customers. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating the cause of these delays.

incidents.name: Increased EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_TIMEOUT errors

incident_updates.body: We have experienced an issue with an upstream provider that resulted in an increased level of 504 (timeout) error rates between 04:00 and 07:15 AM 2024-09-16 UTC. The issue only affected Edge Middleware and Edge Functions that run fetch requests to external endpoints. This has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated 5xx errors in icn1 (Seoul, South Korea)

incident_updates.body: ic1 region was degraded between 21:25-22:49 2024-09-06 UTC. Customers may have seen intermittent 5xx errors. This has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Duplicate total value on upcoming invoice

incident_updates.body: The visual issue has been resolved and all invoices are now showing the correct data. No incorrect invoices were generated and the line items on the dashboard have been corrected.

We are investigating reports of duplicate line items showing on upcoming invoices. This is purely a visual bug on the dashboard which we are actively working to fix. Customers will not be double-charged for their team seats.

incidents.name: Delayed information in Speed Insights, Web Analytics, Runtime Logs, Monitoring, and Firewall observability

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved and new logs are no longer delayed. Data between 15:59 UTC and 16:43 UTC is being backfilled.
We've identified the issue and realtime data is recovering. We are working on backfilling missing historical data.
We are continuing our investigation.

We are currently investigating reports of delayed information in Speed Insights, Web Analytics, Runtime Logs, Monitoring, and Firewall observability. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors in cle1 (Cleveland, USA)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the issue and re-routed traffic to the nearest available regions whilst we work on a fix.

We are currently investigating elevated error rates for Edge Middleware and Edge Functions for traffic in the cle1 region. We are re-routing traffic to the nearest available regions whilst we investigate.

incidents.name: Azure DevOps Extension hangs on deployment step

incident_updates.body: We have reverted the change and introduced a new version 1.6.0. If you had pinned the version to 1.3.0, please ensure you set this back to the latest version.

We’ve discovered an issue where the Azure DevOps extension hangs on the deployment step and will eventually timeout and show as failed. Our team are investigating this currently but in the meantime, please pin the version with:
- task: vercel-deployment-task@1.3.0
to mitigate this

incidents.name: Deployment Creation Errors

incident_updates.body:
We investigated elevated error reports of deployment creation between <tt>12:28-12:38 UTC</tt> for some users.
Existing deployments and live traffic were not affected by this issue.

All systems are normal at this time and no action is required to be taken by affected users.

incidents.name: Missing Build Logs

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and this incident has been resolved. Any previously affected deployments displaying 'No logs to show' will now correctly display build logs.
We are currently investigating reports of missing build logs. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: New deployments are in a queued state

incident_updates.body: We noted builds began to enter a queued state around 18:14 UTC and began to recover around 18:25 UTC. This issue should now be resolved.

incidents.name: Projects integrated with Github affected by service disruption

incident_updates.body:
Teams using Github.com and Github Enterprise Cloud experienced service disruption affecting Vercel deployment integrations. 

This was due to Github repository and webhook availability between Aug 14, 2024 - 23:11 UTC and Aug 15, 2024 - 00:26 UTC.

Further details and incident history:
https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/kz4khcgdsfdv

incidents.name: Postgres Database unavailable for some users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Neon has confirmed all projects are now operational. Neon will continue to monitor the issue. Please monitor our status page and Neon's status page for the latest updates: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia/incidents/01J5903FVM0B3HG8VS8D57HBMS

Neon was able to fix the majority of projects which are now operational. Neon continues to wrap up the remaining few projects. Please monitor our status page and Neon's status page for the latest updates: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia/incidents/01J5903FVM0B3HG8VS8D57HBMS

Neon has identified the issue and providing us with updates. Please monitor our status page and Neon's status page for the latest updates: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia/incidents/01J5903FVM0B3HG8VS8D57HBMS

Neon has put up a status page indicating that their Postgres database is unavailable for some users. For more information, please visit their status page here: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia/incidents/01J5903FVM0B3HG8VS8D57HBMS

incidents.name: Blob Storage Creation Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated error rates when attempting to create new Blob stores on the Vercel Dashboard. Existing stores and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Increased 400s across Middleware and Edge Function invocations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We have published a report in our blog: https://vercel.com/blog/update-regarding-vercel-service-disruption-on-august-7-2024
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause and are working on resolving the issue
We are investigating elevated 400s for Middleware and Edge Function invocations in all regions. Please continue to monitor our status page for updates.

incidents.name: Environment Variable modification errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports from some customers experiencing errors when updating their environment variables. We appreciate your patience and encourage you to monitor our status page for the latest updates.

incidents.name: Increased edge middleware and edge functions failures

incident_updates.body:
There was an increase in Edge Middleware and Edge Functions failures between 2024-07-24 18:53 - 2024-07-24 19:53 PM UTC.

1. Between 2024-07-24 19:13 and 2024-07-24 19:27 PM UTC, requests served from the cpt1 (Cape Town, South Africa) Vercel region may have seen 400 errors on URLs that use Edge Middleware or Edge Functions.

2. Between 2024-07-24 18:53 - 2024-07-24 19:53 PM UTC, Edge Functions specifying the execution region in the function code may have seen 400 errors in any regions.

We've identified the root cause and have rolled out a fix.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating the edge function and middleware failures in CPT1 and will provide updates as they are received.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body: There has been an increase in internal Edge Function failures between 03:26 and 03:38 2024-07-24 UTC. This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved.

The cause of this incident was different from the last incident that happened on 2024-07-10: https://www.vercel-status.com/incidents/d960v5739qdb

Unlike the last incident, the issue did not impact new deployments. Customers may have seen a small amount of INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors on existing deployments during the following windows:

- 2024-07-17 14:30 ~ 2024-07-17 15:40 UTC
- 2024-07-17 19:46 ~ 2024-07-17 22:50 UTC

The issue was resolved by reverting a recent bad release.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Edge Functions & Edge Middleware are degraded, and may return INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED error. We are actively investigating this and will provide updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Builds using pnpm with Node.js 20 intermittently encountering error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We believe the root cause has been identified and a fix is currently being deployed
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for deploying serverless functions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating elevated error rates for deploying serverless functions, resulting in some builds failing. We will continue to update and share our findings as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body:
The incident has been resolved.

This incident affected deployments created between 2024-07-10 21:32 and 2024-07-10 22:26 UTC. Only Edge Middleware and Edge Functions are affected. Deployments created during this window may have seen elevated 500 INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors.

If you still see the error on your project, redeploying your last deployment should resolve the issue.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. For the small percentage of deployments that are still affected please perform an Instant Rollback or Redeploy your project to resolve the issue.

Edge Functions & Edge Middleware are degraded, and may return INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED error. If your deployment is affected please perform an Instant Rollback to a previous deployment as a workaround.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard failing to load

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are aware of an issue affecting the Vercel Dashboard. We are currently investigating and will provide an update soon.

incidents.name: Intermittent empty 200 responses on ISR pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have observed reports of rare, intermittent ISR responses with a status code of 200 containing no content.

We have identified the issue related to a change in our functions infrastructure and the change has been reverted.

We have automatically deployed a resolution to the issue. If you experience this again, please reach out to Vercel Support.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard Errors

incident_updates.body: We have fully resolved this incident.
The fix has been deployed for our Dashboards and we are currently monitoring.
We have identified the issue and have deployed a fix now.
We are aware of issues with our dashboard that may affect your ability to view preview deployments. We are actively investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Vercel Postgres outage in the SIN1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Neon has implemented a fix and we're currently monitoring the results.

Due to a problem with our upstream provider, all databases in the SIN1 (Singapore) region are intermittently accessible. For more information, see the Neon status: https://neonstatus.com/aws-asia-pacific-singapore

incidents.name: Environment Variable modification errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently experiencing issues adding, loading, or modifying environment variables. The root cause has been identified and a fix is underway. Please continue to monitor our status page for the latest updates.

incidents.name: Delayed Runtime Logs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider has fixed the issue and we are currently working to restore all missing logs between 8:24 - 9:29 UTC.
We have Identified an issue where some runtime logs have been missing since 8:24 UTC. We are currently working with the upstream provider to mitigate this.
